item.title: Beckenham Building Supplies parking vehicles that cause hazards for disabled parking, 23rd July
item.description:
For months now every time I park at Eden Park station in a designated disabled bay the trucks from the shop over the main road (Beckenham Building Supplies - name and number are on the vehicles) are parked illegally. They are not parked in any of the bays. Instead they are parked so close to the 2 disabled parking bays it makes it very dangerous to park in and move out of the spaces. It’s impossible to see traffic and there is not enough room to access in/out of car from the road side. Please stop them from parking illegally and dangerously in this location. It is a daily occurrence. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 448-450, Upper Elmers End Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree outside no. 25, 23rd July
item.description:
There is an apple tree owned by the council (I believe sequence 20) in front of our house which has grown quite significantly over the last months and the trees are starting to damage the sidewalk and the wall + fence in the front garden, with some of the branches also being quite close to our bedroom/windows. It has also outgrown the other apple trees on the street, e.g. next to number 31. To prevent any potential damage, can you please prune the tree and cut down some of the branches? I note that there is an open job description (435172), and wanted to understand when this could be arranged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Courthope Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building stuff like sand board , plastic cover left on the street more than 3 weeks, 23rd July
item.description:
Public safety and cleanliness on Barth Road, specifically outside number 5 barth road, Se18 1sg, plumstead Recently, building work was carried out to construct a front porch at this address. Unfortunately, after completing the work, the builders have left sand and some rubbish on the pavement/street directly in front of number 5. This debris is creating a significant obstruction for pedestrians, particularly those with wheelchairs, mobility aids, or prams, and is making it very uncomfortable—and in some cases unsafe—for people to walk along the street. please arrange for the responsible party to promptly clear the sand and rubbish from the path and ensure the area is safe and easily accessible for all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barth Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
